newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: OPEC should satisfy short and long term - PresidenT.
newsitem.headline: OPEC should satisfy short and long term - PresidenT.

text.p: OPEC President and acting UAE oil minister Rakad bin Salem bin Rakad said OPEC should satisfy short and long term fundamentals and not take current prices for granted

"In spite of the presence of improved conditions we must guard against taking the situation for granted," Rakad said. "As we are well aware market fortunes can change radically and rapidly in a short space of time."
"OPEC, while recognising the diverse nature of legitimate interests among the parties within the market, seeks to consistently pursue a policy of cooperation and harmony.
"Decisions and actions should satisfy both short-term situations and longer term fundamentals. If managed properly, these should not be in conflict with each other," Rakad said.
"In essence, the issue is a simple one - to supply oil to those who need it, on mutually beneficial terms.

"Everything else should be secondary to this. We should ensure that our attention remains focused on our deep-rooted commitment to satisfy the collective, responsible interests of our member countries in the best manner possible.
"It is with this is mind that we should proceed with this meeting," he added.
